IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that notice issue to the Respondent to appear, and the Respondent is ORDERED 
to appear in person before this Court at the time and place indicated on page 1 of this form. 
The purpose of this hearing is to determine whether the Court should issue the Protective Orders and 
other relief requested in the Application for Protective Order filed in this case. 
7 Duration of Order: This Order is effective immediately and shall continue in full force and effect until twenty 
(20) days from the date it is signed, or further order of the Court.

8 □ War • g: A person who violates this order may be punished for contempt of court by a fine of as much as 
$500 or confinement in jail for as long as six mon~hs, f both. 
No person, in uding a person who is protected by th' order, may give permission to anyone to ignore or 
violate any pro • ion of this Order. During the time • which this Order is valid, every provision of this 
Order is in full for e and effect unless a court cha ges the Order. 
It is unlawful for any rson, other than a pea e officer, as defined by Section 1.07, Penal Code, actively 
engaged in employmen s a sworn, full-tim paid employee of a state agency .or political subdivision, who 
is subject to a Protective rder to posse0 firearm or ammunition. 
If a person subject to a prote ive ord ~s released from confinement or imprisonment following the date 
the order would have expired, ~✓ft e order would have expired not later than the first anniversary of the 
date the person is released from c nfinement or imprisonment, the order is automatically extended to 
expire on: (1) the first anniversa o the date the person is released, if the person ),Vas sentenced to 
confinement or imprisonment orate of more than five years; or (2) the second anniversary of the date 
the person is released if the erson wa sentenced to confinement or imprisonment for a term of ffve years 
or less. 
A violation of this O~d by commission of an ct prohibited by the Order may be punishable by a fine of as 
much as $4,000 or b confinement in jail for as I g as one year, or both. An act that results in family 
violence may be PJ secuted as a separate misdem anor or felony offense. If the act is prosecuted as a 
separate felon(ffense, it is punishable by confine nt in prison for at least two years. . 
This is a Court Order. No one -except the Court -can change this Order.
